section.name: Remote Auxiliary Http Cache Configuration
section.p: The following properties apply to the Remote Http Cache plugin.

tr.td: This is the full url for the http service.
Should the cache name be appended to the url.
Should the key be appended to the url.
Should the request type be appended to the url.
This allows you to specify your own client implementation.
The number of elements the zombie queue will hold. This queue is used to store events if we lose our connection with the server.

subsection.name: Example Configuration
subsection.source: # This remote client does not receive jcs.auxiliary.RC=org.apache.commons.jcs3.auxiliary.remote.http.client.RemoteCacheFactory jcs.auxiliary.RC.attributes=org.apache.commons.jcs3.auxiliary.remote.RemoteCacheAttributes jcs.auxiliary.RC.attributes.FailoverServers=localhost:1101,localhost:1102 jcs.auxiliary.RC.attributes.LocalPort=1201 jcs.auxiliary.RC.attributes.RemoveUponRemotePut=false jcs.auxiliary.RC.attributes.RmiSocketFactoryTimeoutMillis=5000 jcs.auxiliary.RC.attributes.GetOnly=false jcs.auxiliary.RC.attributes.Receive=false
